subject: Design
subcategory: Design Disasters and What They Teach Us
title: The Precautionary Principle: Design for What You Don't Know
description: A quick win: understand The Precautionary Principle: Design for What You Don't Know.

hook.text: If a new material might cause cancer in 20 years, should we use it now? The precautionary principle says no.

buildup.text: The principle says: if a product might cause serious harm, act preventively even without complete scientific certainty.

discovery.text: Europe applies it to chemicals, GMOs, and AI. Products must be proven safe before release, not after damage.

twist.text: Critics say it blocks innovation. Supporters say asbestos, lead paint, and CFCs prove we should have been more cautious.

climax.text: The precautionary principle asks designers to imagine the worst case â€” and design against it before launch.

punchline.text: The best design disasters are the ones that never happen.

quiz.question: What does the precautionary principle require of product designers?
options: Act preventively against potential harm even without complete proof
